Details: Both outputs provide comprehensive analyses of a Snowflake to PySpark conversion, identifying similar strengths and improvement areas. Analysis_Output_1 focuses on structured numbered sections with API cost tracking, while Analysis_Output_2 provides more detailed technical analysis with complete source code inclusion.

Both outputs address identical core objectives: evaluating Snowflake to PySpark conversion accuracy, identifying discrepancies, and providing optimization recommendations. Minor differences in emphasis on performance vs completeness, but conclusions align on conversion success with improvement opportunities.

Nearly identical logical flow: Summary → Conversion Accuracy → Discrepancies → Optimizations → Assessment → Recommendations. Analysis_Output_1 uses numbered sections (1., 2., etc.), Analysis_Output_2 uses descriptive headers with dashes. Both maintain consistent section organization.
Well-formed documentation structure with consistent formatting. Minor deduction for less detailed technical references and limited code examples compared to comprehensive analysis standards.
Highly comprehensive with complete source code inclusion, detailed technical analysis, and consistent formatting throughout. Minor deduction only for potential over-verbosity in some sections.
Average of individual correctness scores. Both outputs demonstrate high syntactic correctness and internal consistency as documentation artifacts.
